answers.answer: I did vaginal with my first. I prefer vaginal but if it came down to it I'd have a c section because I just want my child delivered safely.I prefer vaginal though as surgery scares me and in my country you can't do anything for 6 weeks after a c section.
@Wolfeenix : after a normal delivery when can you start going out?

Pretty much right away, as soon as you feel comfortable walking but you still have to take it easy anyways.After a c section you can't drive for 6 weeks because if you're in a car accident you're not covered by insurance.You can't pick up your baby for ages or do any bending or lifting because of recovery to your abdominal area after a c section.

@Wolfeenix: that's not true about nit being able to pick up your baby until six weeks . I've already had an cesarean with my daughter & I was able to hold her . Although I was in the hospital for about an week, I went home & was able to do normal things as my cut wasn't bad at all & the surgery was GREAT!
I'm just trying to think rathe or not I should choose a Vaginal birth or a Cesarean.
Not where I'm from, they won't let you pick up the baby right away after a c section.

If i Had the option i would choose vaginal even if it hurts like hell.....i've had 2 csections and omg that ***** u really can do any fast movements or anything for almost 3 months and basically ur csection will remain always unhealed from the inside.....but if it has to be an emergency csection then of course i would do it for my babys health...but prefer Vaginal.
I think imma go with a second cesarean & see if they can tie my tube's possibly as well(: I hope so .
Vaginal , c-sections are terrible I couldn't get in or out of bed and when it was time to get up I cried because it hurt so bad . C-section is an emergency surgery not anything optional.
It's not always an Emergency, & I got a choice because i've had one in the past . Idk whete you're from but we have totally different views.

I would love to try having a vaginal birth. I had a csection with my daughter and it wasn't bad at all. My incision was small and I was up and moving around in no time. I guess everyone has a different experience but mine was pretty good!

Vaginal. It's better for the baby and a better healing process. When the baby comes down the vaginal canal the fluids are squeezed out. They have less respiratory problems as well as less mucous in ears. It's also seems to be more special for mom. When it's vaginal you generally get to hold and look at your baby right away where in a csection they clean up the baby, do the assessment, and then someone can hold the baby up to mom or atleast on the ones I saw. If it came down to my babies safety though I wouldn't think twice. It saves allot of babies loves as well. Healing seems horribly painfull. Moms who had vaginal births jump up much quicker that is depending on the moms. As I said though I would prefer vaginal but wouldn't hesitate if my babies heart rate dropped. Csections are also good for very premature babies who bones arent as hard and skin isn't as tough to not get damage during a vaginal. I'm going to try and go completely natural this time though. Epidural increases the risk of csection and I'm going to try a water birth and have finger crossed.
@mommyof1 , Im from earth darling & OF COURSE we have different views your not me and I'm not you lol.

I don't understand why ANYONE would prefer cs over vaginal. We where made to have babies. Once your done giving birth besides all the blood, it's over. Why would you want to be laid up in the bed bc you CHOSE a cs. It is totally different if you have no choice but of you do have a choice vaginal is so much better.
Ive been told by soooo many women that your 2nd c section is easier then the first because you already know what to expect. & you actually heal faster???? This is from at least 10+ women.

We are all entitled to our own opinions , thank GOD! I honestly know why i'm choosing an Cesarean , With my daughter I was up & walking around the next day . I didn't go through what you guys must've went through. Like the lady said we are totally different human beings(: I know my body well & this will be great for me!

It's not as cut and dried as vaginal or cesarean, especially if you've had a past cesarean delivery. Why did you have a c section last time? Failure to progress, since herpes outbreak, breech baby, etc? (Not judging, just curious)Yes, in general a vaginal birth leads to an easier recovery and is better for baby. But depending on why you had your last c section, it's a whole different story. (Besides, try telling someone who's had an easy recovery from a c section that vaginal birth feels better sooner, then have her talk to me. I had a third degree tear and couldn't walk normally for a good month)It's a personal decision and one I hopefully never have to make. I just pray that I'm able to have uncomplicated vaginal deliveries and never have to debate a Vbac. Good luck, whatever you choose.

To be honest i'm not worried about you judging love(: & the last time I had a cesarean was because my daughter was losing oxygen & I had high-risk preeclampsia . So whose to say I won't have a repeat of preeclampsia? Sometimes your doctor doesn't want to take a risk & neither do I! So i'm doing the right thing and not pressuring myself.

i had a c-section with my first and i was up and walking and everything the same day. My incision had no issues healing and i took absolutely no paun meds after the c-section was finished. Not even tylonal. Everybodys experiences with vaginal and/or c-section are going to be different. And i am also choosing to have a c-section again with this one. With the risk of uterine abruption i am not taking the chance. My doctor informed me that over 90% of women have a successfull vbac but i have already burried one child and i am not taking ANY risk of haveing to do that again, nor will i run the risk of leaving my son without his mother. I have heard the risks of both c-section and vbac and i feel that the c-section has less risk. Judge if you want but i am fine, healed wonderfully, and for the record my son came out fine. And not all hospitals clean the baby and then let someone else hold them to your chest, it is different in each state and country. In ohio we can hold baby while they close the incision as long as baby is healthy. Have a great day everyone!
@Chicanomom08; thank you for your post(: this made me feel tons better!!!

I had a emergency csec with mumy son "faliure to progress" after 26 hours of labour.My epidural did not numb me at all i felt the lot from first incision to last stitch... Im due dec and going to try my best to have a vbac my personal experience was not great i know others have great experiences.Im worried if i have to have another csec this time and muscle memory kicks in and i "feel" what they are doing even though im numbed :(My recovery wasnt great either i ended up with an infection and my incision opened slighty at one end. It took ages to be able to hold my son comfortably and i long for an easy birth and to be able to be up and about quickly.My first son was 10lbs 3 oz hoping this one is smaller.And to those ladies who think vaginal is healthier for bub in regards to squeezing out the liquids from the lungs... My son was born 100% healthy  my cousin had her son vaginally and he had respitory issues due not expelling the liquid properly so actually that isnt true.

That comment wasn't judgemental at all. I said I would do the same if I had to but as a general senses any doctor or nurse will tell you the same thing. It doesn't mean with every circumstance. If you delivery the baby to quickly or if the nurse suction the baby wrong or if they are preterm there is also a risk of respiratory issues. Having a baby is scary! lol I'm just going off of what we are taught in school and what I have heard from other ob nurses. Both my beautifull neice and nephew were born by csection. My sister in law loves it. As I've said many times before everyone is different, every circumstance is different, as well as doctors. Her doctor refused to do a vbac.
Cesareans are Great , especially when you've experienced complications before.

question: Which Do You Prefer & Why?Advantages & Disadvantages :
title: ❤Cesarean Section Or Vaginal Birth?
